item.title: NASA’s upcoming moonshot may let astronauts be the first to lay eyes on parts of the lunar far side that were missed by the Apollo program
item.description: Launching early in the year, the three Americans and one Canadian will zip past the moon, do a U-turn behind it, then hustle straight back to Earth.

item.title: Ahead of meeting with Trump, Zelenskyy says ‘Ukraine is willing to do whatever it takes to stop this war’
item.description: Zelenskyy said the two planned to discuss security and economic agreements and he will raise “territorial issues.”

item.title: Snowflake CEO: Big Tech’s grip on AI will loosen in 2026 — plus 6 more predictions that will define the year
item.description: The real AI race is starting now, and the organizations that lead in 2026 won't be those with the most AI pilots or the biggest technology budgets.
